title: Suggestions for serif w/ long R tail/descender
content:
I'm looking for a nice, classic serif font that has a long cap-R tail/descender that cups the following character.

Similar to this, but hopefully a little more curve in the R tail:

[http://www.hollandandsherry.com/flash/slideshow/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308183605/http:/www.hollandandsherry.com/flash/slideshow/index.htm "http://www.hollandandsherry.com/flash/slideshow/index.htm")

Any ideas?

Thanks!
author: meanjean

comments.content:
The Prestige titling faces that go with [Classica](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308183605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/presencetypo/classica/) have a variety of swash R's.

- Mike Yanega
I'm sorry to revive such an old discussion, but can someone give other examples?
[Organon Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308183605/http:/www.type.co.uk/a_to_z/id/35851) has R alternates with long tails.
